elements.description: Detailed overview of existing studies relevant to the paper's topic. It should consider the methodology, data collection and analysis, and critique the strengths and weaknesses of included studies.
Explanation of how the research was conducted and data was collected. It requires a thorough description of the research processes, procedures and the reasoning behind them.
Report of what the research found. It involves arranging the data in a meaningful manner and showing its significance.
Interpretation and analysis of the results, compared to existing theories and research. It should address the study's limitations and provide recommendations for future research.
Summary of the research conveying the purpose, process and findings of the study.

gost_params.aim and scope of the journal: Defines the journal's subject matter and the types of papers it accepts
gost_params.submission guidelines: Specifies the expected formatting and style for submitted papers
gost_params.review policy: Outlines the process of peer review
gost_params.frequency of publication: Indicates how often the journal is published
gost_params.research ethics guidelines: Details expected ethical considerations and practices
gost_params.copyright: Clarifies ownership of intellectual property rights
gost_params.master's dissertation: Demonstrates knowledge of the published literature on the topic, ability to use published work and source materials, understanding of appropriate techniques, etc.
gost_params.doctoral thesis: Includes all elements of a master's thesis plus distinct contributions to knowledge, discovery of new facts or interpretations of findings
